```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyverse)
```

## Import data Into R



```{r}
nbaelo <- read.csv("https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/nba-model/nba_elo.csv")
```

## Triming the data to exclude some empty columns

```{r}
df1 = subset(nbaelo, select = -c(carm.elo1_pre:raptor_prob2,importance:total_rating) )
``` 

## Further Trimming the data to show just from the 1990 NBA Season

```{r}
df4 <- filter(df1, season == "1990")
```


## View New Subset

```{r}
glimpse(df4)
```
Now instead of 73363 Obs of 27 Variables
we have 1179 obs of 15 variables
